intro: Iria barbata, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom in the spring. Iria barbata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
